please also add comments on what is the life time of these objects ? and whether they are backed up into the filesystem as well or not ?

I updated the commit comments.
Because Fru data will be got in the discovery phase so no need to backed up into the file system.
Done
it be worth to keep the entity aux name here instead of fru ? (if the entity has an aux names pdr)

<TID_Name> is the terminus aux name which you mention.
About the `fru`, I would like to identify that is PLDM Fru Dbus object path that why I use `fru`.

Maybe I will change PLDM object path to to `xyz/openbmc_project/FruPldm/<Terminus_Name>` To consistent with the object path `/xyz/openbmc_project/FruDevice/<Name>` from `xyz.openbmc_project.FruDevice` service. what do you think?

So the PLDM Fru object can be:
```
busctl introspect xyz.openbmc_project.PLDM  /xyz/openbmc_project/FruPldm/S0
NAME                                     TYPE      SIGNATURE RESULT/VALUE FLAGS
org.freedesktop.DBus.Introspectable      interface -         -            -
.Introspect                              method    -         s            -
...
xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Source.PLDM.FRU interface -         -                                  -
.AssetTag                                     property  s         ""                                 emits-change writable
.ChassisType                                  property  s         ""                                 emits-change writable
.Description                                  property  s         ""                                 emits-change writable
.ECLevel                                      property  s         ""                                 emits-change writable
.IANA                                         property  u         52538                              emits-change writable
.Manufacturer                                 property  s         ""                                 emits-change writable
.ManufacturerDate                             property  s         ""                                 emits-change writable
.Model                                        property  s         "00014003"                         emits-change writable
.Name                                         property  s         ""                                 emits-change writable
.Other                                        property  s         ""                                 emits-change writable
.PN                                           property  s         ""                                 emits-change writable
.SKU                                          property  s         ""                                 emits-change writable
.SN                                           property  s         "123445" emits-change writable
.Vendor                                       property  s         ""                                 emits-change writable
.Version                                      property  s         "0.0.00007.003"                    emits-change writable
```
Done

would also like to know the intent behind using the Inventory/Source/PLDM rather than directly hosting the inventory item interfaces ? (because inventory item interfaces are usually looked up by apps like bmcweb to populate redfish inventory). 


Do you also plan to implement patches in bmcweb to expose this data out ?

> would also like to know the intent behind using the Inventory/Source/PLDM rather than directly hosting the inventory item interfaces ? (because inventory item interfaces are usually looked up by apps like bmcweb to populate redfish inventory).

Actually, there is no specific reason. Just because the Fru data is from PLDM Fru commands and there is also `xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Source.PLDM.FRU` D-Bus interface in phosphor-dbus-interface. We didn't think about show up PLDM Fru in BMCWeb.

I think I will also update Fru data to the inventory item object path `/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/board/S0` of terminus name `S0`  as below:
```
busctl introspect xyz.openbmc_project.PLDM  /xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/board/S0
NAME                                     TYPE      SIGNATURE RESULT/VALUE FLAGS
org.freedesktop.DBus.Introspectable      interface -         -            -
.Introspect                              method    -         s            -
...
xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Decorator.Asset       interface -         -                                        -
.BuildDate                                          property  s         "1234"                       emits-change
.Manufacturer                                       property  s         "1234"                       emits-change
.Model                                              property  s         "BMC DC-SCM"                 emits-change
.PartNumber                                         property  s         "DVT1"                       emits-change
.SerialNumber                                       property  s         "12345"                      emits-change
```

What do you think about that? ( I will update code after get your feedback ).

`xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Decorator.Asset` will be consumed by BMCWeb and Redfish.

> 
> 
> Do you also plan to implement patches in bmcweb to expose this data out ?

With the added `xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Decorator.Asset` interface, I think we don't need update BMCWeb or Redfish. I will check that.

> > would also like to know the intent behind using the Inventory/Source/PLDM rather than directly hosting the inventory item interfaces ? (because inventory item interfaces are usually looked up by apps like bmcweb to populate redfish inventory).
> 
> Actually, there is no specific reason. Just because the Fru data is from PLDM Fru commands and there is also `xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Source.PLDM.FRU` D-Bus interface in phosphor-dbus-interface. We didn't think about show up PLDM Fru in BMCWeb.
> 
> I think I will also update Fru data to the inventory item object path `/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/board/S0` of terminus name `S0`  as below:
> ```
> busctl introspect xyz.openbmc_project.PLDM  /xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/board/S0
> NAME                                     TYPE      SIGNATURE RESULT/VALUE FLAGS
> org.freedesktop.DBus.Introspectable      interface -         -            -
> .Introspect                              method    -         s            -
> ...
> xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Decorator.Asset       interface -         -                                        -
> .BuildDate                                          property  s         "1234"                       emits-change
> .Manufacturer                                       property  s         "1234"                       emits-change
> .Model                                              property  s         "BMC DC-SCM"                 emits-change
> .PartNumber                                         property  s         "DVT1"                       emits-change
> .SerialNumber                                       property  s         "12345"                      emits-change
> ```
> 
> What do you think about that? ( I will update code after get your feedback ).

I updated the patch set.

> 
> `xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Decorator.Asset` will be consumed by BMCWeb and Redfish.
> 
> > 
> > 
> > Do you also plan to implement patches in bmcweb to expose this data out ?
> 
> With the added `xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Decorator.Asset` interface, I think we don't need update BMCWeb or Redfish. I will check that.

I tested the latest patch set version. The Fru data is exposed to BMCWeb and Redfish.

based on the design documented in docs/design/pldm-stack :

```
This design is built around the pldmd and entity-manager applications on the BMC:

    The pldmd asks the host firmware's PLDM stack for the host's FRU record table, by sending it the PLDM GetFRURecordTable command. The pldmd should send this command if the host indicates support for the PLDM FRU spec. The pldmd receives a PLDM FRU record table from the host firmware ( www.dmtf.org/sites/default/files/standards/documents/DSP0257_1.0.0.pdf). The daemon parses the FRU record table and hosts raw PLDM FRU information on D-Bus. It will house the PLDM FRU properties for a certain FRU under an xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Source.PLDM.FRU D-Bus interface, and house the PLDM entity info extracted from the FRU record set PDR under an xyz.openbmc_project.Source.PLDM.Entity interface.

    Configurations can be written for entity-manager to probe an interface like xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Source.PLDM.FRU, and create FRU inventory D-Bus objects. Inventory interfaces from the xyz.openbmc_project. Inventory namespace can be applied on these objects, by converting PLDM FRU property values into xyz.openbmc_project.Invnetory.Decorator.Asset property values, such as Part Number and Serial Number, in the entity manager configuration file. Bmcweb can find these FRU inventory objects based on D-Bus interfaces, as it does today.
```

----------

we do need entity manager configs that would probe an interface like `xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Source.PLDM.FRU` - do you have that in place ? can you show how does this look in redfish ? the example you had shown is a DC-SCM above - is that shown in the redfish processor collection ?

> based on the design documented in docs/design/pldm-stack :
> 
> ```
> This design is built around the pldmd and entity-manager applications on the BMC:
> 
>     The pldmd asks the host firmware's PLDM stack for the host's FRU record table, by sending it the PLDM GetFRURecordTable command. The pldmd should send this command if the host indicates support for the PLDM FRU spec. The pldmd receives a PLDM FRU record table from the host firmware ( www.dmtf.org/sites/default/files/standards/documents/DSP0257_1.0.0.pdf). The daemon parses the FRU record table and hosts raw PLDM FRU information on D-Bus. It will house the PLDM FRU properties for a certain FRU under an xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Source.PLDM.FRU D-Bus interface, 


The latest patch set supports this. `xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Source.PLDM.FRU` interface is in `/xyz/openbmc_project/FruPldm/S1` path as below example.


> and house the PLDM entity info extracted from the FRU record set PDR under an xyz.openbmc_project.Source.PLDM.Entity interface.


The latest patch set does not support this part.

> 
>     Configurations can be written for entity-manager to probe an interface like xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Source.PLDM.FRU, and create FRU inventory D-Bus objects. Inventory interfaces from the xyz.openbmc_project. Inventory namespace can be applied on these objects, by converting PLDM FRU property values into xyz.openbmc_project.Invnetory.Decorator.Asset property values, such as Part Number and Serial Number, in the entity manager configuration file. Bmcweb can find these FRU inventory objects based on D-Bus interfaces, as it does today.

In the final patch set, `pldmd` will also create `xyz.openbmc_project.Invnetory.Decorator.Asset` in the inventory object path `/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/board/S1` so no entity-manager configuration is need.

> ```
> 
> ----------
> 
> we do need entity manager configs that would probe an interface like `xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Source.PLDM.FRU` - do you have that in place ?


No we don't. Because `pldmd` already create the `xyz.openbmc_project.Invnetory.Decorator.Asset` in `/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/board/S1` so no need entity-manager configuration.

`xyz.openbmc_project.Source.PLDM.Entity` will be added into this `/xyz/openbmc_project/FruPldm/S1` object path, I think.


> the example you had shown is a DC-SCM above - is that shown in the redfish processor collection ?

It just example. I added the corrected data which I run in the system with the updated patch set.

> > and house the PLDM entity info extracted from the FRU record set PDR under an xyz.openbmc_project.Source.PLDM.Entity interface.
> 
> 
> The latest patch set does not support this part.

I supported this part in patch set https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/76335

I dont think we are following the design as stated in https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/designs/pldm-stack.md#processing-pldm-fru-information-sent-down-by-the-host-firmware

Entity manager is supposed to probe on the `xyz.openbmc_project.Source.PLDM.Entity interface` and should host the Inventory.Item interfaces which should be consumed by bmcweb.

I dont think we should be exposing the `xyz.openbmc_project.Source.PLDM.Entity interface.` interfaces directly to redfish/bmcweb.


In your example above , how is the information from Asset interface appended to the Chassis redfish object ?

> In the final patch set, pldmd will also create xyz.openbmc_project.Invnetory.Decorator.Asset in the inventory object path /xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/board/S1 so no entity-manager configuration is need.

why do you think EM configuration is not needed ? , if the remote endpoint has PLDM_ENTITY_CHASSIS,if pldm is hosting Asset interface , how does that show us as a Chassis in redfish ?

> I dont think we are following the design as stated in https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/designs/pldm-stack.md#processing-pldm-fru-information-sent-down-by-the-host-firmware
> 
> Entity manager is supposed to probe on the `xyz.openbmc_project.Source.PLDM.Entity interface` and should host the Inventory.Item interfaces which should be consumed by bmcweb.
> 
> I dont think we should be exposing the `xyz.openbmc_project.Source.PLDM.Entity interface.` interfaces directly to redfish/bmcweb.
> 
> 
> In your example above , how is the information from Asset interface appended to the Chassis redfish object ?

This question is similar below question, right? So I answer as below.

> 
> > In the final patch set, pldmd will also create xyz.openbmc_project.Invnetory.Decorator.Asset in the inventory object path /xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/board/S1 so no entity-manager configuration is need.
> 
> why do you think EM configuration is not needed ? , if the remote endpoint has PLDM_ENTITY_CHASSIS,if pldm is hosting Asset interface , how does that show us as a Chassis in redfish ?

There are some reason which I think that `pldmd` should directly add `xyz.openbmc_project.Invnetory.Decorator.Asset`.

1. When there are 1x or 5x entity in the system which is reporting thru the pldm adding EM configuration for all of them can cause much headaches.

2. Moreover, the entity name is unknown until `pldmd` discovery terminus PDRs so we should not use the static configuration for them.

3. In the current `pldmd` we are creating the inventory patch for board entity at `/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/board/<EntityName>`, in the future, if the entity is `PLDM_ENTITY_CHASSIS`, we can change the inventory path to `/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/chassis/chassis/<EntityName>` or some thing like that. In this case, `pldmd` will create the `xyz.openbmc_project.Invnetory.Decorator.Asset` in inventory chassis path.
The redfish or web will collect `xyz.openbmc_project.Invnetory.Decorator.Asset` from chassis object path.
4. We still can use entity manager configuration to create `xyz.openbmc_project.Invnetory.Decorator.Asset` while `pldmd` still create `xyz.openbmc_project.Invnetory.Decorator.Asset` right? Maybe I should add the build option to identity if `pldmd` will directly create `xyz.openbmc_project.Invnetory.Decorator.Asset`.

As the discussion in the discord https://discord.com/channels/775381525260664832/778790638563885086/1316321181405806592, I removed the `/xyz/openbmc_project/FruPldm/<terminusName>` object path. The `PLDM.Fru` interface is also removed.
For now we will only have Entity Inventory object path `/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/board/<EntityName>`. `pldmd` will host the inventory object path with the `Decorator` interfaces and `Pldm.Entity` as below:

```
busctl introspect xyz.openbmc_project.PLDM /xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/system/board/S0
NAME                                               TYPE      SIGNATURE RESULT/VALUE                       FLAGS
org.freedesktop.DBus.Introspectable                interface -         -                                  -
.Introspect                                        method    -         s                                  -
org.freedesktop.DBus.Peer                          interface -         -                                  -
